components.description:
A person who wields abilities beyond those of ordinary people who, unlike their nemesis the Superhero, uses their powers for evil. 

This base emoji does not specify a gender, but is used to create the emojis for Man Supervillain and Woman Supervillain.

Google's design is similar to that of Mr. Sinister from the X-Men Marvel comics.
components.title: Supervillain

components.description:
Zero Width Joiner (ZWJ) is a Unicode character that joins two or more other characters together in sequence to create a new emoji.

Zero Width Joiner, pronounced "zwidge", is not an emoji and has no appearance by itself. This is an invisible character when used alone.

View Emoji ZWJ Sequences that use this character.
components.title: Zero Width Joiner

components.description: A circle shown with a crossed vertical line beneath it, used as a representation for women. Often used on International Women's Day.
components.title: Female Sign

description:
A woman who wields abilities beyond those of ordinary people who, unlike their nemesis the Superhero, uses their powers for evil. 

Google's design is similar to that of Mr. Sinister from the X-Men Marvel comics.
title: Woman Supervillain
apple_vendor_description: The woman supervillain emoji, as seen on Apple devices, is a captivating portrayal of formidable power with a touch of dramatic flair. Her costume, rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading, features bold colors and sharp accents that suggest both danger and sophistication, while realistic lighting accentuates her confident, perhaps even menacing, expression. The soft, rounded edges of her design prevent her from appearing too harsh, allowing for a playful yet impactful representation of strength, defiance, or a mischievous spirit in digital communication.
